metadata.name: Launch Agent/Daemon Execution Via Launchctl
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of programs as Launch Agents or Launch Daemons using launchctl on macOS.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/launchctl')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('submit')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('load')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('start'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of programs as Launch Agents or Launch Daemons using launchctl on macOS.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities is expected to trigger false positives. Investigate the command line being passed to determine if the service or launch agent are suspicious. References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1569.001/T1569.001.md, https://www.sentinelone.com/labs/20-common-tools-techniques-used-by-macos-threat-actors-malware/, https://www.welivesecurity.com/2020/07/16/mac-cryptocurrency-trading-application-rebranded-bundled-malware/, https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/18/d/new-macos-backdoor-linked-to-oceanlotus-found.html, https://www.loobins.io/binaries/launchctl/
